infos.value: This time, allow me to discuss <color=#0000ff>TP</color>, <color=#0000ff>AP</color>, and <color=#0000ff>Limit Bursts</color>.
Depending on the properties of an ability, you will need either <color=#0000ff>TP (Technical Points)</color> or <color=#0000ff>AP (Attack Points)</color>.

<color=#0000ff>TP</color> is mainly used for abilities with <color=#0000ff>supportive</color> effects, while <color=#0000ff>AP</color> is mainly used for abilities that deal <color=#0000ff>damage</color> directly.
TP is <color=#0000ff>completely full</color> at the onset of battle and <color=#0000ff>does not replenish</color> without the use of items such as Ether.
Conversely, AP is scarce at the onset of battle but can be <color=#0000ff>accumulated</color> by using normal attacks or TP-consuming abilities.
<color=#0000ff>Limit Bursts</color> are abilities possessed by some units that are equivalent to <color=#0000ff>special techniques</color> and require <color=#0000ff>a great deal of AP</color>.
Please be mindful of the fact that each ability has a <color=#0000ff>limited number of uses</color>.
As expected of you, Lord Mont!
Did you notice that the windows of abilities requiring TP are <color=#0000ff>yellow</color> while those requiring AP are <color=#0000ff>pink</color>?
Support-type TP and the attack-type AP... Understanding the characteristics of each will bring you one step closer to mastering the ways of battle.
